annotation: father: father's brothers, mother's sisters' husbands
grandfather: father's father, mother's father, grandfather's brothers and sisters; ancestor
mother; aunt: mother's sister, father's brother's wife; second cousin: mother's female cousin, father's male cousin's wife
rack for drying or smoking fish and meat
father-in-law: husband's father, husband's uncles, wife's father, wife's uncles
spear, iron tool: having iron as its basic component
burn, cook until ready to eat
grandmother: father's mother, mother's mother, grandmothers' sisters, grandfathers' sisters; female ancestor
mother; aunt: mother's sister, father's brother's wife; second cousin: mother's female cousin, father's male cousin's wife
real part of something; reality; essence, truth
sister-in-law: husband's sisters and female cousins, brother's and male cousin's wife
paddle a canoe or boat; mash
uncle: mother's brother and male cousin, father's sister's husband and father's female cousin's husband
Raggiana Bird of Paradise; Lesser Bird of Paradise
head of the body, head of a line of people, leader of a group of people
sorcerer, magician, shaman (lit: 'poison holding much doing-one')
nose; point of a peninsula; point of a talk
sap from a tree, juice from sugar cane or fruit or coconut
squid ink, used as a dye for drawing on tapa bark cloth
large pigeons or fruit dove from the Columbidae family
generic word for lizard, lizard skin is used to make the tympanum of kundu drums
large bowl made from a canoe hull or from the kwila tree
bear (a load); shoulder, carry on shoulder
